unnormalised: AIIMS Delhi prepones Oncology Dept. appointments, citing "bhayanak" rush! Seems like everyone suddenly wants to be cancer-free, eh? Dr. Sharma's clinic usually sees 50 patients/day, but last week it was like a mela! Apparently, some WhatsApp forward claimed turmeric cures everything, so folks rushed for check-ups just in case.
normalised: A-I-I-M-S Delhi prepones Oncology Department appointments, citing "bhayanak" rush! Seems like everyone suddenly wants to be cancer-free, eh? Doctor Sharma's clinic usually sees fifty patients per day, but last week it was like a mela! Apparently, some WhatsApp forward claimed turmeric cures everything, so folks rushed for check-ups just in case.

unnormalised: The hospital spokesperson, Mr. Kapoor, stated, "We're trying to accommodate everyone, but patience is key. Please, don't believe everything on social media!" New appointments are now being scheduled for Oct 27th onwards. Bring your reports, your hopes, and maybe a pinch of that miracle turmeric... just kidding!
normalised: The hospital spokesperson, Mister Kapoor, stated, "We're trying to accommodate everyone, but patience is key. Please, don't believe everything on social media!" New appointments are now being scheduled for October twenty seventh onwards. Bring your reports, your hopes, and maybe a pinch of that miracle turmeric... just kidding!

unnormalised: So, if you've got a nagging cough or just feel like being extra cautious after reading some random online "gyan", book your appointment. Just remember, waiting lists are longer than a Bollywood wedding buffet queue. Good luck and stay healthy, folks! And maybe, just maybe, consult a real doctor before self-medicating with haldi.
